title: Why the winter coat of the season is actually a cape - and the best ones for every occasion
text:
When I was a little girl fresh off the boat (ok, plane) from Australia, my mother bought me my first winter coat - I hadn’t needed one in the Queensland climate.

If the accent didn’t make me stand out enough, the coat did: it was a navy blue cape, and this the mid-nineties, when all the other children were wearing puffers.

True to form, my mother comes out of this story rather well, since most ‘90s fashions are best forgotten, and A-line woolen capes are timeless.

Even so, it’s taken me some twenty five years to consider trying another - and just a few weeks to wonder why I’ve waited so long.

They’re incredibly practical, as you can layer them over as many layers as you like without creating...
